name: Christmas team event - Cultural and culinary tour de France / walking food tour
description:
To celebrate the end of the year and the Festive season with you team, discover authentic French shops and products in the city and inner north and finish with a lunch or aperitif (pre-dinner drinks) - date to be agreed. 

Take a look around Carlton and Fitzroy and discover some authentic French shops and taste some authentic French products. The tour will include informative talks from shop owners. Chocolate, Cheese and Charcuterie tastings are included in this tour and a French lunch or aperitif will complete our time together.

Fee: $160pp with a group 8 (minimum) to 20 people. Coffee and some of the best French pastries in Melbourne, all tastings and lunch (some information sheets, discounts at stores visited are included).

Group of 8 participants minimum. Please contact us to organize a suitable date if this one does not suit.

Outcomes
At the end of this course you will have:
Had a memorable team building and festive event
Shared an experience with your team 
Improved your culinary knowledge about French chocolate, cheese and charcuterie products
Learned about the history of vintage posters
Discovered authentic imported French products
Discovered authentic French restaurants, cafes and shops.

name: Discover French Champagne with Gilles Lapalus - Book your corporate or private function
description:
Born in Cluny, Bourgogne, into a family in the wine industry for three generations, Gilles graduated as an oenologist from Dijon University before undertaking winemaking in several French regions, in Tuscany and in Chile. 
Gilles has now settled as the winemaker of the Sutton Grange winery in Castlemaine:  www.suttongrangewines.com. 

This is a boutique event with a minimum number of guests of 12(maximum of 24 people) at $140 per person.

name: Book your Patisserie masterclass with Pierrick Boyer from Le Petit Gateau: Cooking Parisien macarons
description:
This exclusive Art de vivre masterclass will allow you to spend two and half hours with Pierrick Boyer, Chef patissier from Le Petit Gâteau and discover some of his secret recipes of gâteaux or pâtisseries or french specialties such as macarons!

When: Saturday afternoons

This masterclass will occur at Le Petit Gateau. 
15 participants minimum or $2,250 and $150pp over 15 participants up to a maximum of 20.

name: Chocolate appreciation with Laurent Meric, from Cacao - Book your corporate or private function
description:
This exclusive chocolate appreciation masterclass with Laurent Meric, Maitre Chocolatier of Cacao Fines Chocolates will take you through the world of chocolate, the origins and history, the production and the plant itself, and of course the good effect of its consumption! There won't be any guilty afterthoughts!

Participants will enjoy tastings of chocolates of diverse origin, the Cacao fine chocolates and take away some printed information as well as a gift wooden box of four chocolates. 

To customize this event for your private function, please contact us. Alternatively, book now for a minimum of 12 people and we will organise the event according to your date and venue requirements. 

Champagne or other drinks can be organized in addition to the standard chocolate event. Please contact us for a quote.

name: On your bikes! Cultural and culinary tour de France / food tour - book your private group
description:
To celebrate the 2011 Tour de France, discover authentic French shops and products in the city and inner north on your bikes! 

Take a look around Carlton and Fitzroy and discover some authentic French shops and taste some authentic French products. The tour will include informative talks from shop owners. Chocolate, Cheese and Charcuterie tastings are included in this tour and a French lunch will complete our time together.

Start: Meet at Parliament Station (Macarthur St entrance) at 9.30am of Gertrude Street, BYO helmet. Bikes can be rented out at the front of Parliament station or BYO.
The tour will also end at Parliament Station.
Guides: Muriel Brock and Vaiana Hellebout.

Fee: $149pp with a group of 6 to 8 people. Morning tea coffee and some of the best French pastries in Melbourne, all tastings and lunch (some information sheets, discounts at stores visited are included).

Outcomes
At the end of this course you will have:
Improved your culinary knowledge about French chocolate, cheese and charcuterie products
Learned about the history of vintage posters
Discovered authentic imported French products
Discovered authentic French restaurants, cafes and shops.

name: Discover French cheeses with Matthieu Megard,L'Artisan cheese-book your corporate / private function
description:
Matthieu Megard, cheesemaker from l'Artisan cheese Timboon will take you through the discovery of several French cheeses: Roquefort, Comté, Ossau Iraty for instance and some of his own produced here in Timboon: his great roblochon, his triple brie and some faisselle.

This event will run for approximately 90 mins for a minimum of 12 people and limited to 24 people. You will discover 6 great cheeses, learn about their region, the traditions and how to taste these. 

A glass of wine will be served to accompany your tasting. Tips on wine and cheese matching will be provided.

name: Cultural and culinary tour de France - Saturday afternoons
description:
Discover authentic French shops and products in the city and inner north. Have you ever wondered where the Melbourne's French community shops and meets?
Take a look around Carlton and Fitzroy and discover some authentic French shops and products.
Let's meet the French who have settled here and want to share their expertise and creativity with Melburnians. A French lunch will complete our time together.

Venue: Meet at 9.30am at Mr Truffe, 90 Smith Street, near the corner of Gertrude Street, Fitzroy for a chocolate tasting, coffee and some of the best French pastries in Melbourne.

Guide: Muriel Brock
Fee: $160 - includes morning tea and lunch, chocolate, cheese and charcuterie tastings, discounts at shops, taxis and some information sheets.

The tour will include informative talks from shop owners, discount vouchers as well as tastings of chocolate, cheese and charcuterie products.
A specialised culinary bookshop, a vintage poster shop, a deli shop importing high quality French produce and a Charcuterie. In each case, the host will spend time with us, providing background on their products and the history of the art or craft involved. Lunch will take place at a French restaurant in Carlton or in the CBD.
The tour will involve about 1/2 an hour of walking and we may travel by taxi (included).

Outcomes
At the end of this course you will have:
Experienced 4 hours of discovery to share with your friends
Improved your culinary knowledge about French chocolate, cheese and charcuterie products
Learned about the history of vintage posters
Discovered authentic imported French products
Discovered authentic French restaurants, cafes and shops.

name: Discover Cognacs with Valérie Blayac matched with chocolates from Monsieur Truffe
description:
Discover Cognacs and Armagnacs, France well known brandies accompanied by single origin chocolates from Monsieur Truffe.
Valerie Blayac from Spirits of France will introduce top of the range Cognacs and Armagnacs served on the best tables in France, their rich history, the regions of France they originate from and the distillation processes. Tips on how to appreciate the spirits will also be included in this unique and upmarket masterclass. 

Late afternoon / evening session for approximately 2 hours 
Venue: can be at your site or at an agreed external location (a surcharge may apply depending on location). 

This is a boutique event to be booked for a group with a limited number of guests (from 12 to a maximum of 24 people) at $160 per person.

name: From the bean to the bar -  Discover Monsieur Truffe's chocolate factory
description:
FROM THE BEAN TO THE BAR
This event was selected at the 2011 Food and Wine Festival. 

Open the red door of Monsieur Truffe's bean-to-bar chocolate factory for a unique opportunity to see how chocolate is made, from cocoa roasting to conching. See and understand the process of making chocolate from the bean, including a chocolate appreciation workshop, discovering a selection of single origin chocolates and tasting Monsieur Truffe’s inimitable hot chocolate.
 
At Monsieur Truffe new cafe: 351 Lygon st, east Brunswick
The event generally goes for two hours and can be customized for your private or corporate function.  
One hour will be to go through the factory and one hour will be an Chocolate appreciation/tasting workshop.
This event can be accommodated for groups of 15 to 25 attendees.

name: Cultural and culinary tour de France - Book your corporate or private food tour/function
description:
Take your team for a French food tour for an indulgent and fun group event. 
Discover authentic French products and taste unique chocolate, cheese and charcuterie in the trendy inner north near Gertrude St. 
Let's meet the French who have settled here and want to share their expertise and creativity with Melburnians. A French lunch (morning tour) or pre-dinner drinks and nibbles (afternoon tour) will complete our time together.

When: Thursdays (9.30am-2pm), fridays (2 to 6.30pm) or Saturdays (9am-2pm). Other times may be agreed.

Venue: Meet at Mr Truffe, 90 Smith Street, near the corner of Gertrude Street, Fitzroy for coffee and some of the best French pastries in Melbourne.

Guide:Muriel Brock
Fee: $159pp for a minimum of 8 people. 
Includes for the morning tour: morning tea and lunch, chocolate, cheese, charcuterie tastings.
Includes for the afternoon tour:afternoon tea, chocolate, cheese and charcuterie tastings, and pre-dinner drinks and nibbles.


The tour will include informative talks from shop owners, discount vouchers as well as tastings of chocolate, cheese and charcuterie products. 
A specialised culinary bookshop, a vintage poster shop, a deli shop importing high quality French produce, a charcuterie and a chocolate shop. 
In each case, the host will spend time with us, providing background on their products and the history of the art or craft involved. Lunch will take place at either a classy French venue in a Melbourne CBD laneway (weekdays) or at a trendy Bistro near Gertrude St for pre-dinner drinks(on Fridays - note that dinner can be organised in addition to the tour).
The tour will involve about 1/2 an hour of walking and we may travel by taxi (included).

Outcomes
At the end of this course you will have:
Improved your culinary knowledge about French chocolate, cheese and charcuterie products
Learned about the history of vintage posters
Discovered authentic imported French products
Discovered authentic French restaurants, cafes and shops
Discussed French culture and customs with French people.

name: Children's patisserie class with Christelle from Petit Chef-book your private birthday party
description:
French cooking class or birthday party for children
for a minimum of 8 children or $320 
at your home (Melbourne inner city and suburbs)

Create a piece montée (croque en bouche) for a great birthday cake as all the kids can participate in. Also each child will learn to prepare a “Charlotte aux fraises” to take home.

The party will run for 90 mins and are limited to 16 children.
The classes are best suited for children aged between 5 to 12 years old.

name: Melbourne Food and Wine Festival - 700 years of Armagnac - Saturday 5th March
description:
700 YEARS OF ARMAGNAC
Discover Armagnac, France's oldest spirit, celebrating its 700th anniversary in this appreciation workshop presented by Valerie Blayac from Spirits of France. Your evening of sensory discovery will include tastings of three Armagnacs and two Cognacs, accompanied by chocolates from Monsieur Truffe at his cafe in Smith St Collingwood near Gertrude St.

When: Saturday 5th March from 7 to 9pm
Where: Monsieur Truffe, 90 Smith St Street, Collingwood

Includes five tastings and chocolates
Gift vouchers available

name: French Basque linen apron - Ainhoa
description:
Artiga was founded in 1910 in the Basque Region, near the spanish Border, in the South West of France. Since then, four generations of weavers have remained loyal to the Basque Spirit. 
Basque Linens are made high quality color resistant fabrics. The palette of colors is inspired from the strong regional tones which associate thin and wide stripes, the genuine signature of Basque fabrics.

Fabric: 100% cotton
Care Instructions:
• To respect the quality of fibers, let your new linen soak in cold water for 2 hours before the first use. Put the wet item in the washing machine and run a normal 30°C wash cycle, using your regular detergent. You can expect that this kind of natural linen will shrink up to 8% in length.

• Wash colored cloth separately two or 3 times

• Wash at a maximum of 60°C after the first use

categories.name: Cassis Art de la table shop

Fabric: 70% cotton 30% linen
Care Instructions:
• To respect the quality of fibers, let your new linen soak in cold water for 2 hours before the first use. Put the wet item in the washing machine and run a normal 30°C wash cycle, using your regular detergent. You can expect that this kind of natural linen will shrink up to 8% in length.

• Wash colored cloth separately two or 3 times

name: French traveller tour de France (4 sessions) - Coming soon
description:
Prepare your next trip to France and get all your questions answered!
The workshop includes a language session for basic French or practice for the more advanced. You'll gain confidence in coping with many varied situations such as meeting new people, ordering food and drinks in cafes and restaurants, asking for directions, and shopping.
In addition to this, we will provide you with some tailored hints and tips about your next travel and you will receive a small guide of Paris we compiled especially for this course.

4 sessions
Morning sessions: Thursdays 10.30am-12.30pm, starting the first Thursday of each month with a traditional "petit creme et croissant". 
Evening sessions: Thursdays 8pm-10pm, starting the first Thursday of each month
with a an amusing patisserie (dessert) or a cafe gourmand.

Venue: at one of our partners restaurant and cafes: South Yarra, Hawksburn, Fitzroy or in the CBD.

Fee: $320 for the 4 workshops. Maximum of 6 people. 

Outcomes
At the end of the workshop you will be in a position to:
Understand and feel at ease with cultural differences
Communicate in simple situations
Review you trip plan to ensure it will meet your expectations
Enjoy your time in Paris more
